Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2012 04:14PM Gail35 wrote: Thanks for the reply Etherize. Unfortunately I do not remember the name of the procedure, but it involves placing a wire into the duct to look for abnormalities.
Posts.Title: Don't know what to do Gail35 etherize

Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2012 04:37PM Gail35 wrote: Thank you, after doing a little more research I believe the procedure I was thinking of is called a ductogram or galactogram.
Posts.Title: Don't know what to do Gail35 etherize

Posts.Content: Gail35 wrote: Hello everyone. I am 35 years old and have been experiencing spontaneous unilateral breast discharge for about 3 months. It started out white, but lately has been clear. Prolactin levels were checked and are normal. Mammogram and breast ultrasound were done. I was told that I had fibrotic breast and a 6 month follow up mammogram was recommended. I had a follow up appointment with my doctor a few days ago. I told him that considering my extensive family history of cancer I do not feel comfortable waiting 6 months for a follow up, so he scheduled a needle biopsy. I was asked to obtain my records to bring with me. My concern is that in reading the radiologist report of the mammogram they mention a focal asymmetry that is only visible on one view, and it is in the same breast which has the discharge. Of course I have googled this and am now worried. I have read about a procedure where they can check the ducts in your breast. Should I ask my doctor about this? Will a simple needle biopsy find cancer if it is in the duct? Any advice is appreciated. I am so lost and scared. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Don't know what to do Gail35 etherize
